thread.title: Bangalore molestation: Swara Bhaskar asks Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara to resign after the unfortunate incident
thread.title_full: Bangalore molestation: Swara Bhaskar asks Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara to resign after the unfortunate incident

author: Snehal Rajani
title: Bangalore molestation: Swara Bhaskar asks Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara to resign after the unfortunate incident
text:
5 lessons Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan should learn from Dangal's actor Aamir Khan 
What’s happened in Bangalore is downright disgusting. I mean, I don’t even have words to describe how I feel when I see all such things happening around me. It’s rather depressing to see women getting molested, raped and touched inappropriately anywhere and everywhere in the country. The Bangalore molestation video is going viral on social media sites and for all those who haven’t watched it yet, I’d suggest, please do. It is utterly shameful to see what’s happening to the women in our country. This isn’t about Delhi or Bangalore being unsafe but about the mentality and upbringing of men in India. It’s high time, we take strict action against such incidents. Among Bollywood actors who has strongly reacted to the Bangalore molestation case is Swara Bhaskar. The actress took to Twitter to share her views on the unfortunate incident and here’s what she has to say: #Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara you must resign.. you share the mentality of the molesters #bangaloremolestation #bangalore #shame. 
I don’t know if the Karnataka minister’s resignation would help solve the purpose but one thing that I know for sure is that until and unless the government and police don’t become stricter with their rules and punishments, there is no chance that these hooligans would change. Women in the country need to be treated with dignity and men need to realise that we are not objects of their desire. What Swara has tweeted shows how furious the Bangalore molestation case has made her and I am sure the entire nation feels the same too. But will the country’s rules become stricter? Will there be harsh punishments imposed on molesters and all those who commit such heinous crimes? (ALSO READ: Bengaluru molestation: Aamir Khan calls the situation ‘saddening’ and ‘shameful’ ) #Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara you must resign.. you share the mentality of the molesters #bangaloremolestation #bangalore #shame 
— Swara Bhaskar (@ReallySwara) January 3, 2017 

— Sir Ravindra Jadeja (@SirJadeja) January 4, 2017 
Here’s how everyone else on Twitter has reacted to the Bangalore molestation case so far: MG road in Banglore is ‘Molest Girl’ Road and HM of Karnataka was therefore defending Molesters. #bangaloremolestation 
— WINGS OF FIRE (@shenoy70) January 4, 2017 
This is such a shame…these people deserves to be behind bars all their life…. #bangaloremolestation https://t.co/9RBzRRvK5K 
— Vineet Agarwala (@vineetagarwala) January 4, 2017 Feeling sick as more and more reports of #bangaloremolestation coming in. 

A woman wearing ‘half’ clothes is not the problem you dimwit! Your ‘half’ brain is! #bangaloremolestation #SackSexistNetas 
— Vishakha J Singh (@vishakhasingh55) January 3, 2017 
What do yopu have to say about the Bangalore molesttaion case? Do you support Swara’s views? Drop in your comments below.
